title: Ethereum Basic Technology Test
description:
This challenge is used to test your understanding of Ethereum-related technical knowledge, including Ethereum consensus, address wallets, browsers, transactions, DEFI, EVM compatible chains, and other knowledge.
 The challenge contains about 30 choice questions, there may be one or more answers, please answer carefully.

questions.title: Who proposed Ethereum?
What do you think Ethereum can be?
What is the native token of the Ethereum blockchain?
What programming language can be used to write smart contracts on Ethereum?
What is the block time of Ethereum?
Which of the following descriptions of Ethereum's features is correct?
options: Can store any type of data
Transaction speed is very fast (millisecond level)

questions.title: Which currencies can be traded on the Ethereum network?
Which of the following is one of the main advantages of Ethereum?
What can be the application scenarios based on Ethereum?
Which one is a decentralized application based on Ethereum?
What is the most commonly used blockchain browser on the Ethereum network?
Which of the following Ethereum wallets is a physical device?
What is the abbreviation for the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)?
Which **is not** an Ethereum wallet?
What consensus mechanism is currently used in Ethereum?
Which of the following are Ethereum's layer 2 scaling solutions?
What is the correct address format on Ethereum?
Which of the following practices are **not recommended** for Ethereum wallet security?
options: Hand-copy the private key or mnemonic phrase regularly
Use screenshots or notepad software to save the mnemonic phrase
Send the private key to a friend using social software

questions.title: The correct description of the difference between ETH and USDC on Ethereum is?
options: ETH is the native coin on the chain
USDC is an ERC20 token, a smart contract coin
USDC is a stablecoin pegged to the US dollar
The value of ETH fluctuates with demand

questions.title: The token of NFT (non-fungible token) we often talk about refers to tokens that meet which standards?
In the Ethereum network, every transaction requires a certain amount of Gas fee. Which of the following **will not** affect the Gas fee of a transaction?
When you send a transaction on the Ethereum network, you need to set the Gas price. Which Gas price setting strategy is **best**?
options: Set a price far higher than the current market Gas price to be packaged faster
Set a price far lower than the current market Gas price to save Gas fees
Choose an appropriate price based on the urgency of the transaction and the current market Gas price
Set the Gas price to the lowest as long as the transaction can be packaged

questions.title: The correct description of the Ethereum account model is?
options: The account does not contain ETH balance
The account contains the transaction sequence number (nonce) sent from that address
The account contains the balance of held tokens

questions.title: The correct description of Ethereum transaction fees (Gas) is?
options: All transaction fees are collected by miners
Only a part of the fee is the miner's income
Some fees are charged by the project party
Only ETH can be used to pay for Gas

questions.title: The correct descriptions of the contract address are?
options: Can be viewed on the blockchain browser, and if there is associated code, it is a contract address
There is no difference in format between the contract address and the ordinary user address
If you accidentally transfer tokens to a contract address, it may not be possible to withdraw them
Contract addresses cannot hold assets, only user addresses can hold assets

questions.title: The correct description of Ethereum smart contracts is?
options: Smart contracts are programs running on the chain
The word 'smart' reflects its ability to automatically run according to rules, such as setting to run automatically after 1 month
Smart contracts are not really smart, programs with a large amount of computation cannot run as smart contracts on the chain
Any program can run as long as enough Gas is provided
Smart contract code can only be run by triggering transactions from external accounts

questions.title: The correct descriptions of the differences between decentralized applications (DApps) and traditional centralized Apps are?
options: Logging in with a wallet account is a decentralized application, logging in with an email or phone number is a centralized application
It is possible that the difference between decentralized applications and centralized applications may not be visible on the front end
The key difference lies in the backend, the backend data of centralized apps is stored on centralized servers, while the core data of decentralized applications is stored on the chain
Operations in centralized applications can usually be executed immediately, while operations in decentralized applications usually need to wait for consensus across the network to be truly executed

questions.title: The correct descriptions of the features of EVM compatible chains such as BSC and Polygon are?
options: EVM compatible chains have the same security as Ethereum
EVM compatible chains have the same address format and use the same developer tools as Ethereum
Most smart contract codes can be deployed directly on various EVM compatible chains without modification

questions.title: The correct descriptions of the deployment of contracts and accounts on EVM compatible chains such as BSC and Polygon are?
options: The same private key has the same address on the compatible chain
The same private key may or may not have the same address on the compatible chain
The same contract code deployed on the compatible chain has the same address
The same contract code deployed on the compatible chain may or may not have the same address

questions.title: The correct descriptions of the interaction between EVM compatible chains are?
options: Because EVM compatible chains have compatible contract codes, they can directly call each other
Each EVM compatible chain is an independent blockchain, and their interaction usually requires the use of cross-chain bridges
Because each EVM compatible chain has independent consensus, they cannot interact
